intro: Phalangium algeriense, commonly known as the Algerian scorpion grass, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common floral arrangement in the Apiaceae family. Phalangium algeriense is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
